label: 玄奘
本: Jewel in the Ashes: Buddha Relics and Power in Early Medieval Japan . Harvard University Asia Center . 2000
説明文: süan-tsang (Ch.) 玄奘, also called 玄奘三蔵、三蔵法師 J. Genjō sanzō, Sanzō hōshi. Monk famous for his trek to India (629-45), the record of his trip, as well as the voluminous scriptures he brought back with him and translated. He was specially known for his studies of Hossō in his day.
